channel.title: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine
channel.description:
ok to cut a long story short, i would like to find the angle the mouse is from a point using trigonomentry of a right angled triangle
everythings fine until i remembered that to find the angle, i dont use [b]Sin([/b], but i have to use inverse sin [b]Sin-1( [/b][IMG]http://img49.imageshack.us/img49/2172/inversesinni6.png[/img]
iv looked though SCAR and found there is no inverse Sin, so im asking someone whos good at maths, is there a way i can construct the function, il already tried "1/Sin(" but it doesnt work
also note that SCAR sin uses radians, not degrees

item.title: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Just a note: 1/sin(x) is csc(x), quite different from sin-1(x).

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine

yer… that sin to the negative one is arctan, not the reciprocal

item.title: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

yakman:

Sin-1(

is also known as arcsin (which is in srl\core\math.scar)

Edit: also arctan is inverse tanget and arccos is inverse cosine…

Edit2: can be found in 3rd result of googling inverse sin

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine

item.title: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

no, to find the length of a side in right-angled trigonometry, i have to use sine [Sin(]
but for finding the angle in right-angled trigonometry, i have to use inverse sin [sin-1(]

go to most scientific calulators, press shift and sin, it leads to inverse sin

wheres that guy who made the SRL mouse, benland100 i think

maybe i should ask this on SRL forums

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with Maths- Sine and Cosine

-Sin()

~Ron
